Max Goof.Action: Approaches Roxanne gently, laughs with her, shares a meaningful moment, and almost kisses her.
Pushes through wheat field to find Roxanne and shares a playful, lighthearted moment with her, showing engagement and social confidence.
Reaches out to catch Roxanne but loses his balance and they both tumble to the ground.
Maintains a meaningful connection and almost kisses Roxanne, indicating emotional and social awareness.
Apologizes to Dad for the messy room and promises to take care of it later.
Shows embarrassment and irritation when Dad barges in without knocking.
Gets upset and reacts emotionally when Dad accidentally damages the Powerline cutout.
Responds sarcastically when Dad asks about Powerline, downplaying the significance.
Waves back to classmates who laugh at him after a kiss on the cheek from Goofy, despite feeling embarrassed
Tries to escape his dad's playful dancing and attention quickly, worried about neighbors seeing them
Expresses determination not to be the target of ridicule anymore and wants to change how others see him
No significant friendly or trustworthy interaction with peers; shows distress when bullied and rejected
Tries to escape from embarrassing situation with his dad, runs out the door, attempts to open gate and then skillfully jumps over it despite difficulty.
Stumbles and slips on marbles, bumping into other kids, then is physically pushed aside and has his lunch taken.
Waves back embarrassed but tries to maintain composure despite being laughed at by classmates.
Starts a conversation expressing his intention to talk to Roxanne confidently.
Looks sadly after Roxanne ignores him, showing awareness of social dynamics but seeming discouraged.
Recognizes the need for positive proof that he's not just a goof, indicating self-awareness and motivation to improve.
Runs through a flock of pigeons, causing chaos, which reflects impulsive and awkward behavior.
Runs to class energetically, tries to make the best of the day despite chaos around him.
Accidentally bumps into Principal Mazur, knocking his toupee askew (unintentionally disruptive).
Trips and falls at the bleachers, is laughed at by others but Roxanne helps him.
Is abbergasted when Roxanne helps him after his fall, indicating appreciation and openness to kindness.
Slides down a banister and bumps into Principal Mazur, knocking his toupee askew.
Runs onto the track, flips over a hurdle, and keeps going past others exercising.
Runs up to the top of the bleachers and enjoys the wind blowing in his face, showing a confident moment.
Trips and falls down the bleachers, landing on his face and flailing.
Recovers quickly from the fall and stands up when Roxanne approaches to help him.
Babbles incoherently and laughs goofily in front of Roxanne, then runs away embarrassed.
Self-critical and berates himself for acting awkwardly around Roxanne, showing insecurity and sincerity.
Approaches PJ in a friendly manner and discusses plans sincerely about the camera.
Babbling incoherently and laughing silly when nervous, then running away after embarrassing himself in front of Roxanne.
Berates himself for messing up the chance to talk to Roxanne, showing self-awareness.
Initiates conversation with PJ and is proactive about obtaining a camera for a plan involving Roxanne.
Expresses excitement and optimism about the AV equipment, indicating enthusiasm and some planning ability.
Grabs PJ and helps him up after he trips on cables backstage.
Pokes head out from behind curtain to check on others, shows concern.
Closes curtain and focuses on task, not reacting to Chad talking to Roxanne.
Dresses up in a Powerline costume and coordinates backstage activities with Bobby and PJ.
Helps PJ up after he trips over cables, showing awareness and responsiveness.
Expresses uncertainty aloud: 'I hope this works...'
Dons Powerline visor and gives others thumbs up backstage, encouraging camaraderie.
Lip-syncs energetically to Powerline song, inspiring the crowd and receiving positive audience reaction.
Trips and falls on stage, causing a disruption but continues performance.
Dons Powerline visor, confidently gives thumbs up backstage, performs lip-synching and energetic Powerline tribute on video screen.
Trips and falls caught in cables, causing a disruption by ripping the screen and rolling onto the stage.
Looks nervously at the crowd, but reassured by Roxanne's shy smile, he confidently heads toward her.
Lip-syncs Powerline's song passionately, directing his performance sincerely toward Roxanne to gain her attention.
Attempts an impressive stunt on a cable toward Roxanne to impress her, but is stopped abruptly by the cable, causing a spin and interruption.
Despite being stopped, maintains some composure as Roxanne smiles appreciatively.
Expresses self-doubt and fear of failure after trouble at school.
Reluctantly accepts responsibility to guard Bobby's cheese sculpture despite his own worries.
Admits to feeling like a failure and blowing his chance to impress Roxanne.
Accepts responsibility by guarding the can of squeeze cheese for Bobby despite stressful circumstances.
Sits motionlessly with his head in his hands, showing withdrawal and unawareness of Roxanne trying to talk to him
Quickly apologizes after knocking Roxanne's books to the floor and helps pick them up
Pulls his hand away embarrassed after accidentally touching Roxanne's hand
Asks Roxanne to the party with genuine nervousness and respect for her choice.
Celebrates Roxanne's acceptance joyfully and shares his happiness with others around him.
Receives praise from peers for his dancing at the concert, indicating a successful performance and social validation.
Appears incredulous and surprised at positive feedback, showing some lack of confidence or self-awareness.
Enjoys and encourages supportive chanting from friends (PJ, Bobby, cheerleaders).
Slaps hands with people on the sidewalk and bus windows, sharing enthusiasm and connecting with others.
Dumps PJ on the ground after PJ jumps on his shoulders, showing mild roughness but no malice.
Dumps PJ on the ground playfully, showing physical agility and quick reaction.
Engages confidently with peers, accepting their cheers and encouragement.
Lip-syncs to the Powerline song confidently, indicating performance skill and self-assurance.
Navigates various obstacles in the environment skillfully (jumping, swinging, skateboarding).
Acts playfully with PJ, which could be seen as immature but also indicates comfort and confidence.
Wishes his dad a good time on vacation and asks him to drop a line if gone more than a month.
Collapses in shock and appears uncomfortable upon hearing the vacation is together with Goofy.
Expresses distress at Goofy’s playful attempts to engage him (e.g., dressed up with fishing gear and inflatable vest).
Exasperatedly rejects Dad's comparison and old-fashioned fishing trip plans
Shows surprise and slight skepticism about the long fishing trip
Exclaims with exasperation and dismisses the fishing pole as 'a stick'.
Expresses reluctance and doubts about the length of the fishing trip.
Waddles over to inspect the old map despite his initial reluctance.
Shows shock and surprise when seeing the map and realizing the trip would take weeks.
Pushes the map aside and verbally rejects the plan, showing resistance rather than engagement.
Accepts going on a trip with his dad despite frustration and exasperation, resigns himself to the situation.
Stops the car abruptly to try to talk to Roxanne, showing care about his feelings and relationships.
Grabs the steering wheel and causes a dangerous swerve, showing impulsiveness and disregard for safety.
Politely asks if Roxanne is home despite initial intimidation from her father.
Quickly puts hands behind back and grins innocently when startled by Roxanne's father.
Expresses sincere disappointment and desire to spend time with Roxanne at the party.
Complains about father's 'father-son' kick and reluctantly accepts situation.
Panic when Roxanne almost leaves to go to the party with someone else, blurts out a lie about his dad taking him to a concert
Expresses hope to see Roxanne onstage and affirms he wouldn't miss their date for anything incredible
Looks sadly out the window, quickly turns away from camera when prompted by Goofy, puts hand over lens, expresses irritation at dad's request to wave.
Participates unenthusiastically in game suggested by Goofy, answers questions though clearly not excited.
Looks sadly out the window, avoids engaging with Goofy’s cheerful attempts to connect, puts hand over camera lens, responds irritatedly with 'Not now, Dad.'
Responds unenthusiastically but correctly to Goofy’s guessing game with brief and accurate answers.
Expresses concern about leaving Roxanne and admits he might be in traction when he returns, showing vulnerability and sincerity.
Shares a moment of genuine emotional connection with Goofy about being out on the open road and feeling like crying, indicating warmth and openness.
Gives Goofy a dirty look when he refuses to give him the map and insists on navigating himself.
Expresses discomfort and embarrassment at the run-down tourist trap and refuses to join Goofy inside, choosing to wait in the car instead.
Grins sheepishly back at the little girl smiling at him
Rolls his eyes at Goofy and resigns himself to pouting during the show
Looks down at the little girl and exchanges smiles
Calls the performance 'pathetic' and shows visible resignation
Expresses disappointment openly, calling the show pathetic and rolling his eyes at Goofy.
Observes the situation and the emotions of the little girl, responding with a sheepish grin, showing social awareness.
Resigns himself to pouting and puts his head in his hands after the show malfunctions.
Angrily tells costumed character not to touch him and slaps him when hugged forcibly.
Watches contentedly and smiles as kids tackle and drag away the annoying costumed character.
Warns Lester about grabbing him but fails to stop it in time.
Quickly slaps Lester to stop him and effectively disorients him, leading to kids tackling Lester.
Watches contentedly as Lester is removed by kids, showing calmness and confidence after handling the situation.
Walks away slowly from the souvenir stand initially, appearing disengaged or reluctant.
Allows Goofy to put an embarrassing hat on him despite protesting, showing limited assertiveness.
Expresses clear embarrassment and discomfort with Goofy's antics and protests against wearing the possum hat.
Tries to get rid of the possum stuck in his shirt despite the chaotic situation, demonstrating patience and resilience without lashing out.
Allows Goofy to include him in the dance after the possum incident, showing a degree of tolerance and participation despite initial irritation.
Tries to avoid embarrassing situation but ends up with a possum in his shirt, then manages to get it out by pulling his pants down and extricating the possum.
Reacts with shock and embarrassment to Goofy’s antics, unable to prevent the situation but handles it relatively well once it happens.
Initially protests and tries to avoid the photo with possums but does not prevent it successfully.
Glares furiously at laughing crowd, throws possum hat down, shoves a laughing kid to the ground, storms off angrily
Rejects Goofy's touch and attempts to distance himself by walking away
Attempts to get away from Goofy, expressing frustration and anger
In a fit of rage, screams, tears at the possum hat, throws it out the window, and verbally lashes out at Goofy.
Rolls down the window and throws the hat out, showing a decisive, if emotionally charged, action.
Sits absent-mindedly by the creek, staring into the water, lost in thought and disengaged from the present.
Declines Goofy's invitation to fish practice with a vague 'Maybe later' and walks away dragging a stick, showing avoidance and lack of engagement.
Shows curiosity and interest by coming out to see the large RV and commenting positively.
Does not intervene or help when Goofy is unexpectedly hit by the metal door.
Shuts off the loud stereo in the RV despite the challenge of the high volume, showing practical problem-solving.
Engages smoothly and confidently in a long, involved handshake and friendly banter with PJ, demonstrating social ease and interpersonal skill.
Expresses surprise at PJ knowing about the Powerline concert, which indicates a lack of foresight to keep plans confidential.
Walks away dejectedly and leans on the door frame, showing a moment of emotional vulnerability but perhaps also a lack of confidence to confront issues head-on.
Smiles when invited to dinner by Pete
Gets angry and pushes Goofy's hand away when Goofy tries to connect
Jokes playfully with Goofy, showing comfort and light-heartedness.
Looks away with Goofy when 'I love you' is mentioned, indicating discomfort with emotional expression.
Attempts to fill silence with polite inquiry about the soup, showing effort to maintain connection.
Jokingly uses complex words like 'Ambidextrous' and phrases like 'Hasta la vista' during conversation, showing some verbal wit and comfort with language.
Looks blank or confused when asked about 'Hi Dad Soup,' indicating a lack of recall or connection to past knowledge.
Tries to fill uncomfortable silence by inquiring about the status of the soup in a somewhat hesitant manner, showing social awareness but some awkwardness.
Expresses genuine surprise and interest when Goofy opens the soup can with his teeth, showing curiosity and openness to learning new things.
Writes a sincere letter to Roxanne admitting he lied about going to the concert, showing honesty and vulnerability.
Smiles and is touched by Goofy’s innocent sleep-talking, demonstrating affectionate and tender feelings toward his dad.
Debates and nervously alters the map course without telling Goofy, showing secrecy and possible avoidance rather than openness.
Decides to write a truthful letter to Roxanne despite the risk of disappointing her, showing awareness and emotional insight.
Carefully studies Goofy's map and notices a potential shortcut to Los Angeles, then attempts to alter their route by drawing a new course despite the risk of waking Goofy.
Nervously tries to erase and redraw the map route with a breaking pencil while Goofy begins to wake up, showing both resourcefulness and anxiety.
Stops mid-letter realizing the possible consequences, displaying self-doubt and hesitation.
Tears up a postcard with 'I lied' written on it and lets the wind carry the pieces away, indicating a moment of guilt or dishonesty.
Is distracted and preoccupied, not fully engaging with the waitress or the meal, showing signs of inward focus and possible avoidance.
Nervously responds to Goofy's question with an uncertain answer.
Tears up a postcard he had written and lets the wind carry the pieces away instead of sending it.
Is preoccupied and doesn’t hear the waitress calling him to pick up his food.
Absently picks at his food and seems distracted at the diner.

Enjoys the roller coaster ride immensely

Notices Goofy is uncomfortable at the monster truck rally but does not intervene

Sits and talks with PJ calmly despite stressful situation with Pete and Goofy.
Silent and wide-eyed when Pete's plan unfolds, showing surprise but no immediate action.
Defends his plan as not stupid when talking to PJ, showing confidence in his ideas.
Greets his dad cheerfully and tries to ease tension after Goofy returns looking shell-shocked.
Greets his dad cheerfully and tries to improve an awkward situation by apologizing for the mess.
Shrugs confusedly when his dad walks in looking shell-shocked, showing a lack of understanding of the situation.
Tries to improve the situation by offering to clean up the mess.
Greets PJ warmly with 'See ya, Peej!'
Feels nervous and undecided when driving, showing some insecurity but not hostility.
Tries to lighten the mood with jokes and suggesting a game despite tension with Goofy.
Attempts to make amends and approach Goofy after a tense event.
Realizes the car is rolling away, alerts Goofy, and quickly reacts to stop the car.
Manages to open the passenger side door and unlock the driver's door under pressure, saving Goofy from falling over the canyon.
Tries to communicate and make amends with Goofy but is initially ignored.
Kicks the tire angrily leading to the car rolling away unintentionally.
Pulls the door shut and opens the window for Goofy to get through; helps pull Goofy onto the roof of the car.
Blames Goofy repeatedly for the situation instead of focusing on solutions.
Argues and shows a lack of control while the car is bouncing and spinning wildly.
Expresses frustration and emotional immaturity by saying he never wanted to go on the vacation and wants to stay home.
Continuously reacts emotionally and avoids taking responsibility for the predicament.
Despite the danger, maintains presence to help with practical actions like pulling Goofy onto the roof.
Engages in playful banter with Goofy to lighten tense moments and keeps a positive outlook despite difficulties.
Casually reacts nonchalantly when a fish grabs his toe, indicating alertness and a calm demeanor.
Passively allows the car to float into a whirlpool without showing proactive attempts to escape or regain control.
Demonstrates emotional maturity by acknowledging Goofy’s support and reliability in crises.
Recognizes the danger of the waterfall and warns Goofy.
Holds on to the car as it spins and sloshes through the rapids.
Shows doubt or hesitation when Goofy suggests a plan involving Powerline stage performance.
Responds quickly and without hesitation to help Goofy by attempting The Perfect Cast to save him.
Shows concern and fear when Goofy is in danger, calling out 'Dad!'
Dives for the fishing pole to be rescued but misses and falls back into the water.
In a moment of crisis, remembers and attempts 'The Perfect Cast' without hesitation to help Goofy.
Reels in the line furiously to successfully catch Goofy, showing quick thinking and perseverance.
Max and Goofy hug firmly, both with tears in their eyes.
Max tosses the map away, showing a relaxed and letting-go attitude after a crazy vacation.
Max shows worry and hesitation backstage, indicating concern about their plan.
Max gets distracted by the attractive dancers, loses sight of Goofy momentarily.
Has a brainstorm to join the performance onstage with Powerline and dances sincerely.
Accidentally causes the guard to fall by bumping a light but quickly recovers and continues to entertain the audience.
Slides onto the stage between his dad and Powerline, dancing and sharing the moment with them.
Has a brainstorm under pressure and instructs Goofy to perform the Perfect Cast, contributing creatively to the performance.
Handles a dangerous situation physically by grabbing a rope, causing a guard to fall and disrupt the security without panicking.
Slides onto the stage and confidently dances with Goofy and Powerline, showing social and performance skills.
Appears on TV dancing well and impressively, eliciting surprise and admiration.
Admits to lying to Roxanne about knowing Powerline and seems unsure of himself after the concert.
Rings Roxanne's doorbell despite fear she might never talk to him again, showing initiative and courage.
Walks away sadly and picks a flower after the awkward encounter with Roxanne's father and clarifying his lie.
Successfully calms down after a nightmare and tries to answer the phone.
Fumbles phone receiver and drops it, then dives to pick it up.
Does not check the time until prompted, then realizes he is late.
Immediately tries to get dressed quickly and assures PJ that he's on his way despite struggle with pants.
Pulls up his pants quickly when embarrassed by his dad walking in unexpectedly.
Admits the mess in his room and tries to gather his things quickly, though the room is cluttered and disorganized.
Responds quickly to vacuum incident by shutting off the vacuum with his foot to save his Powerline cutout.
Runs late and appears rushed and somewhat disorganized.
Ignores his dad’s offer for a ride to work to get exercise despite being late, showing some independent decision-making.
Attempts to talk to Roxanne despite feeling like a fool, tries to find the right thing to say.
Waves at Roxanne who doesn't notice him, then looks away sadly.
Hands Bobby a brown paper bag with money (fee) despite Bobby's needy and somewhat messy behavior
Reacts with nausea to Bobby's reckless spraying of cheese, but allows the interaction to continue

Responds incredulously but acknowledges praise from peers after concert.
Resigns himself to the situation after his dad insists on the trip, showing some adaptability.
Forcibly grabs the wheel and maneuvers the car sharply to stop and talk to Roxanne despite the dangerous driving and crashing fire hydrant.
Forgets or neglects immediate concerns about safety and property damage when taking control of the car recklessly.
Remembers his date with Roxanne and attempts to take initiative to make a phone call, showing responsibility.
Nervously rings the bell and awkwardly speaks to Roxanne's father, showing hesitation and lack of confidence.
Quickly recovers from being startled by Roxanne's father by grinning innocently and avoiding conflict.
Initiates conversation with Roxanne and shows genuine interest in attending the party with her despite difficulties.
Appears incoherent and dejected when explaining his situation, showing emotional overwhelm and some inability to clearly communicate.
Continues interacting with Roxanne despite awkwardness and disappointment, trying to express his desire to go with her.
Plays air guitar loudly and continues his music despite Goofy trying to sing along, interrupting and escalating a musical conflict.
Sighs and looks out the window after the stereo breaks; does not further escalate conflict despite frustration.
Pries Goofy's arms off his neck and returns to his original position, exasperated.
Looks bored and exasperated during Goofy's playful attempts to cheer him up.
Imagines a cloud shaped like Roxanne, showing his softer, affectionate side.
Expresses feelings about the road trip with some humor and emotional honesty.
Does not intervene when Goofy almost hits a tow truck, showing no immediate reaction or corrective action.
Glares furiously at the laughing crowd and throws the possum hat down in disgust, then shoves his way out of the crowd knocking a kid to the ground.
Attempts to open the car door but it is locked; hits the window in frustration.
Walks out into the rain and tries to hitchhike, but gets soaked by a passing car and reacts angrily.
Jerks away from Goofy's touch and angrily expresses he is trying to get away from him.
Decides to stop engaging with Goofy and insists on leaving soon after tensions rise.
Brightens up at the prospect of seeing his best friend PJ, smiles at PJ's silly routine

Turns off the loud music without consideration that PJ is still singing and performing.
Teases PJ by scaring the octopus in the fish tank.
Responds to PJ's friendly and supportive remarks about Max's upcoming concert with surprise but does not reject PJ's enthusiasm.

Hands the camera to Goofy to capture the moment despite danger, indicating helpfulness and cooperation.
Realizes the danger posed by Bigfoot before Goofy does and warns him by screaming.
Only reacts by screaming and does not take further action to manage the situation.
Warns his dad that Bigfoot is coming and helps get into the car quickly through the sunroof.

Expresses hunger openly to his dad, shows shared experience and concern during encounter with Bigfoot.
Shows fear and calls out to his dad to stop playing around during Bigfoot's approach.

Wipes soup off his face awkwardly but continues to share a moment with Goofy, showing sincerity and vulnerability.
Unable to sleep, writes a postcard to Roxanne, indicating thoughtfulness and consideration towards others.
Accepts the role of official navigator and head which- way-er of the road trip, receiving Goofy's trust and the map.
Shrinks into his seat, appearing embarrassed and sheepish when given responsibility.
Joins Goofy in a toast to the open road, showing readiness to engage positively in the trip.
Attempts to change a flat tire with Goofy but hits his head accidentally in the process.
Reaches for the spare tire simultaneously with Goofy and hits his head, then rubs his head and allows Goofy to get the tire.
Enjoys the roller coaster ride confidently.
Cheerfully offers Goofy junk food despite Goofy being sick after the ride.
Notices Goofy is holding his head to block out the noise at the monster truck rally, showing awareness of other's discomfort.
Uncovers Goofy's eyes to surprise him at their current stop, showing thoughtfulness and planning.
Observes street performers and participates playfully with Goofy in a mime act, then leaves when a piano falls.
Struggles to remove the blown tire while Goofy pumps air in the new tire.
Exchanges pleased glances and high fives with Goofy after teamwork on the car tire.
Fumbles catching a ball but shares a smile and catches Goofy when he falls back to his seat.
Excitedly jumps on the waterbed and shares his enthusiasm with Goofy.
Laughs and plays along with Goofy during the playful shoving and joking, showing affectionate interaction.
Responds to the loud pounding and yelling at the door by cautiously approaching it with Goofy, showing awareness and some caution.
Jumps on the waterbed excitedly without hesitation, showing playful engagement but not necessarily competence.
Does not show signs of being truly frightened by Pete’s fake machine gun attack; instead engages in playful shoving and banter with Goofy, indicating emotional control and confidence.
Engages in playful physical interaction and banter with Goofy despite the tense situation, showing social confidence but possible lack of seriousness.
Does not appear to take Pete’s aggressive act seriously and relies on humor and physical play rather than taking defensive or evasive action.
Quietly gives Goofy advice and stands speechless and wide-eyed with Goofy during Pete's manipulations.
Talks with PJ about how Goofy might fall for a 'stupid idea,' showing skepticism about his dad.
Admits to panicking and not knowing what he was doing when changing the map.
Admits he panicked and didn't know what he was doing when changing the map.
Acknowledges Goofy's flaws with humor and teasing but expresses appreciation and loyalty by repeatedly affirming 'Nobody else but you' and singing about sticking together through hardships.
Shows concern for his dad when the car is heading toward the waterfall, tries to warn him.
Continues to hold on during the rapids, calls out for his dad.

Admits to Roxanne that he lied about knowing Powerline and feeling insecure about the truth.
